greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients of polynomials defined by the Binet form P(n,x) = U^n + L^n, where U = (x + d)/2, L = (x - d)/2, d = (4 + x^2)^(1/2). Decreasing powers of x.
comment: For a signed version of this triangle corresponding to the row reversed version of the triangle A127672 see A244422. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Aug 07 2014
The row reversed triangle is A114525. - _Paolo Bonzini_, Jun 23 2016
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: G.f. of polynomials P(n,x): (2 - x*z)/(1 - x*z - z^2).
G.f. of row polynomials R(n,x) = Sum_{m=0..n} T(n,m)*x^m:  (2 - z)/(1 - z - (x*z)^2) (rows for P(n,x) reversed).
For n > 0, T(n,2*m+1) = 0, T(n,2*m) = A034807(n,m). - _Paolo Bonzini_, Jun 23 2016
example: The row polynomials R(n, x) are:
mathematica: Table[Reverse[CoefficientList[LucasL[n, x], x]], {n, 0, 12}]//Flatten  (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 05 2018 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2009
